Prasad, John Wiley & Sons, Hoboken, New Jersey 2003[br/]Optical Biosensors[br/]Ligler, FS. and Rowe Taitt, CA. (2002), Elsevier[br/]Biophotonics: Optical Science and Engineering for the 21st Century[br/]Shen, X. and van Wijk, R. (Eds):Springer, Berlin, 2006[br/]Advances in Biophotonics[br/]Wilson, B.C., Tuchin, V.V. and Tanev, S. NATO Science Series: Life and Behavioural Sciences, Volume 369, IOS Press, Amsterdam, 2005
free_text.Contenu: We will focus on aspects following biophotonics aspects: light - biological matter interactions, optical spectroscopies and their applications, lasers in biology and medicine, photobiology, optical imagery, optical biosensors, light as a therapeutic tool, micro-array technology, laser tweezers and emerging biophotonic technologies.
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: The aims of the course are :[br/][br/][li] Understand light-biological matter interaction; such as absorption, emission, spectral response, reflection fluorescence, scattering, etc.[br/][li] Optical sources and detectors [br/][li] Extend this understanding to interaction with cells and tissue highlighting the physical characteristics used in the applications to follow [br/][li] Fluorophore development and functionality, fluorescence microscopy of the cell cycle [br/][li] Show some therapeutic applications of light (Photo-activation of drugs Photo-dynamic therapies Tissue engineering with light) [br/][li] Initiate the students to optical techniques applied to biological materials[br/][li] Give an overview of optical biosensor methods[br/]Fluorescent labeling and the mechanism of fluorescent resonant energy transfer (FRET), FLIM, FRAP, FCS: applications to biosensors, Raman-based biosensors.[br/]Labelfree: Surface Plasmon resonance (SPR) and dielectric waveguide methods, biosensors based on whispering gallery modes in microresonators.[br/][br/]At the end of the course, the student would have acquired the required knowledge to apprehend the future biophotonics practical applications.
